description: From Medieval Latin crānium (“skull”), from Ancient Greek κρᾱνίον (krāníon, “skull”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) That part of the skull consisting of the bones enclosing the brain, but not including the bones of the face or jaw.
examples: Hyponyms: calvarium, ethmoid, frontal, occipital, parietal, sphenoid

entries.meaning: (anthropology, informal) The upper portion of the skull, including the neurocranium and facial bones, but not including the jawbone (mandible).
